title: User Guide
text: Prepare input genomes P. aeruginosa PAO1 PA14 strains, E. coli K12 MG1655: Convert CubSet objects: Get reference set highly expressed genes (based work Sharp Li (1986) done E. coli): Find subset genes genomes, calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) reference set. Compare RSCU randomly generated DNA:
code: pao1 <- pao1 pa14 <- pa14 ek12 <- k12 cub01 <- CubSet(pao1) cub14 <- CubSet(pa14) cub12 <- CubSet(ek12) ref00 <- Sharp166$gene[Sharp166$expression == 'very high'] library(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PAO1) library(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PA14) library(TxDb.Ecoli.K12.MG1655) library(ggplot2) library(ggpubr)  map01 <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PAO1, names(pao1), 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME') map14 <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PA14, names(pa14), 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME') map12 <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Ecoli.K12.MG1655, names(ek12), 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')  idx01 <- as.numeric(na.omit(match(ref00, map01[, 2]))) idx14 <- as.numeric(na.omit(match(ref00, map14[, 2]))) idx12 <- as.numeric(na.omit(match(ref00, map12[, 2])))  ref01 <- CubSet(pao1[idx01]) |> rscu() ref14 <- CubSet(pa14[idx14]) |> rscu() ref12 <- CubSet(ek12[idx12]) |> rscu()  dna   <- sapply(ek12[idx12], length)  dna   <- Biostrings::DNAStringSet(sapply(dna, \(x) { dnar(x) })) refrd <- CubSet(dna) |> rscu()  prd <- cplot(refrd) + ggtitle('Randomly generated DNA')  p01 <- cplot(ref01) + ggtitle('Reference set, P. aeruginosa PAO1') p14 <- cplot(ref14) + ggtitle('Reference set, P. aeruginosa PA14') p12 <- cplot(ref12) + ggtitle('Reference set, E. coli, K12 MG1655')  ggarrange(p01, p12, p14, prd, ncol = 2, nrow = 2) + ggtitle('Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU)')

title: User Guide
code: res01 <- cai(cub01, ref01) res14 <- cai(cub14, ref14) res12 <- cai(cub12, ref12)  dt <- data.frame(   cai = c(res01, res14, res12),   org = c(     rep('P. aeruginosa, PAO1', length(res01)),     rep('P. aeruginosa, PA14', length(res14)),     rep('E. coli, K12 MG1655', length(res12))     )   ) |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(cai))   pd <- ggplot(data = dt, aes(x = cai, fill = org, colour = org)) +   geom_density(linewidth = .25, alpha = .5) +   labs(title = 'Codone Adaptation Index', subtitle = 'Calcuated per each individual gene', x = 'CAI', y = 'Desinty') +   ggthemes::theme_few() pd

title: User Guide
code: idx_high <- which(res01 >= quantile(res01, .95, na.rm = TRUE)) idx_low <- which(res01 <= quantile(res01, .05, na.rm = TRUE)) pao1_high <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PAO1, names(pao1)[idx_high], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2] pao1_low <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PAO1, names(pao1)[idx_low], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2]  pth  <- KEGGREST::keggLink('pathway', 'pae') gns  <- KEGGREST::keggList(paste('pae', pao1_high, sep = ':')) dt   <- data.frame(path = pth[names(gns)], genes = names(gns), func = gns) table(dt$func)

title: User Guide
code: idx_high  <- which(res14 >= quantile(res14, .95, na.rm = TRUE)) idx_low   <- which(res14 <= quantile(res14, .05, na.rm = TRUE)) pa14_high <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PA14, names(pa14)[idx_high], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2] pa14_low  <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Paeruginosa.PA14, names(pa14)[idx_low], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2]  pth  <- KEGGREST::keggLink('pathway', 'pau') gns  <- KEGGREST::keggList(paste('pau', na.omit(pa14_high[1:250]), sep = ':')) dt   <- data.frame(path = pth[names(gns)], genes = names(gns), func = gns)  table(dt$func)

title: User Guide
code: idx_high  <- which(res12 >= quantile(res12, .95, na.rm = TRUE)) idx_low   <- which(res12 <= quantile(res12, .05, na.rm = TRUE)) pa14_high <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Ecoli.K12.MG1655, names(ek12)[idx_high], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2] pa14_low  <- biomaRt::select(TxDb.Ecoli.K12.MG1655, names(ek12)[idx_low], 'TXNAME', 'CDSNAME')[, 2]

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dmytro Strunin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Strunin D (2023). cub: Collection tools Codon Usage Bias analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cub: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis},   author = {Dmytro Strunin},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: Cub package provides tools whole-genome codon usage bias analysis.

title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: can install development version cub GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("utubun/cub")

title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: section can find examples package usage

what: Create a Cub object from DNAString
title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: package contains CDSs extracted PAO1 PA14 genomes. can use datasets shown : Next, construct Cub instances datasets: package provides set functions designed work objects.
code: library(cub) pao1cds <- PAO1CDS pa14cds <- PA14CDS pao1 <- Cub(pao1cds) pa14 <- Cub(pa14cds)

what: Import Cub objects directly from the package data
title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: Cubs PAO1 PA14 directly available package, can import shown :
code: pao1 <- PAO1 pa14 <- PA14

title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: Currently can plot codon counts, Relative Synonymous Codon Usage indices (1), Relative Codon Adaptation indices (1), Codon Adaptation Indices (1) absolute scaled genome, individual amino acid. counts
code: plot(pao1, value = 'count', scale = FALSE) plot(pao1, value = 'count', scale = TRUE) plot(pao1, value = 'count', scale = 'aa')

title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: Follow usual R pattern saving data. example, save codon counts absolute, scaled amino acid, following:
code: count(pao1) |>   as.data.frame() |>   xlsx::write.xlsx('./data/xlsx/pao1_cdn_cnt.xls', 'Counts', row.names = F)

title: Collection of tools for Codon Usage Bias analysis
text: Sharp PM, Li WH. codon Adaptation Index–measure directional synonymous codon usage bias, potential applications. Nucleic Acids Res. 1987 Feb 11;15(3):1281-95. doi: 10.1093/nar/15.3.1281. PMID: 3547335; PMCID: PMC340524

text: data.frame columns aa: Amino Acid, codon: Codon code, rscu: RSCU x(, j) given codon.

title: Converts Counts instance into data.frame — as.data.frame,Counts-method
code: Cub('A DNA', PA14CDS[[1]]) |>   rscu() |>   as.data.frame() |>   head() #>   aa codon val #> 1  *   TAA NaN #> 2  *   TAG NaN #> 3  *   TGA NaN #> 4  A   GCT NaN #> 5  A   GCC NaN #> 6  A   GCA NaN
